reviewText: Besides being a really good, albeit, tragic story, the acting is superb, in my opinion. I have seen the movie at least three times and finally decided to purchase the DVD.  How SAD that a father would actually con his own daughter into killing her step-mother is unbelievable!!  The worst part of it all is it really happened!!!  I have the book that Ann Rule wrote about the case, as well ("If You Really Loved Me"). It is one unforgettable movie that you must see.  Read the book, too.
summary: One Sad, tragic story and true story!

reviewText: This is about a diabolical man, David Brown, who was in many ways just as evil as the devil himself. Clancy Brown is superb in this role, much better looking than the real David.This is a true story also, there is much evil in this world and this is just one of those examples.It is worth watching, am so glad that it finally appeared on DVD.

reviewText: I remember when I first saw this & how it pulled me in, I was 14 in 1985 as well, so Cinnamon Brown is the same age as me, this film is about a man named David Brown who was a master manipulator who convinces his 14 year old daughter & his 17 year old sister-in-law to partisipate in the murdering of his wife in March 1985, Cinnimon takes the blame & is sent away to a juvenile facility, meanwhile David collects on life insurance & moves into a bigger more fancy home, & manipulates his 17 year old sister-in-law, & eventually marries her too, & leaves his daughter to stay in prison to fend for herself, Clancy Brown (T.V.s "Lost") is very convincing as Brown, a very underated actor, Sheryl Lee(Vampires) is also convincing as the sister-in-law, but the real standout performance is Moira Kelly as Cinnamon, who had a few films after this, but never really made it big, she should have, John Ashton (Beverly Hills Cop) is great as the D.A. investigator who refused to give up on the case, Daivd Brown almost got away with the perfect murder, but when his daughter realizes that he no longer cares about her, she works with investigators to bring David to justice, there isn't much I can say that others haven't covered here, except to say that in 1990 after five years David was brought to justice & is now serving a life sentence in prison, I believe Cinnemon was released on her 25th birthday in 1995, I am assuming, haven't really researched what happened to her, the fact that this really happened is chilling to watch, great perfromances by everyone here, & one of the few T.V. films I wanted to own, Cynthia Nixon (Sex & the City) is here as well as the nanny that David has a romance with as well, this was truly a sick & twisted man, how anyone could do this to their own daughter is beyond me, but the ending is very satisfying.
summary: A true story about one evil man!!

reviewText: I have watched this movie many times.  I always go away with the same thought - how can two females allow themselves to be controlled by the words and actions of one sick man.  Yet, I too have lived like this.  It is based on a true story and I enjoy it every time I view it.

reviewText: I'm so happy to finally have this movie on dvd. One of my favorite Lifetime movies.. My only complaint is that a part of the movie was changed slightly.. The part where Patty and Donna are making the bed and Sister Sledge is playing in the background. That part of the movie was slightly edited and the song was changed. But, other than that the movie seems okay. It's not a big deal.. I was just surprised they changed part of the movie being it has never been on dvd until now. I had this on dvd+r recorded off Liftime and before that on vhs years ago.. Don't really understand why they would do that unless due to a copyright issue or something.. Still happy to have Love, Lies and Murder on dvd! It's about time! :D
summary: Love, Lies and Murder Finally on dvd! :)

reviewText: Update:  I just wanted to say that I received this DVD and it works Great, I was very happy since I have been waiting for a long time to obtain this movie on DVD. :)This a 1991 "Lifetime Channel" True Life movie about a man, David Brown, who convinces his daughter and young sister-in-law that his wife is conspiring to kill him so he convinces them to kill his wife first, then he starts having an affair with his 16 yr old sister-in-law and later marries her only to plan to kill her for the insurance money(just like his first wife), all the while his 14 yr old daughter, Cinnamon Brown, was arrested for the crime because her father told her she won't get as much time because she is a minor 4 years later she starts to realize that her father is a liar and tricked her so she works with two investigators to get her father to confess, they already suspected that there was something more to the story than what Cinnamon was confessing to, with there investigation they uncover the twisted private world of David Brown himself unfolded with astonishing clarity -- revealing a trail of perverse love, twisted secrets, and evil mind games. A complex and often dangerous investigation suggested a horrifying scenario: was the seemingly bland David Brown really a stone-cold killer -- who convinced his own daughter to prove her love by killing for him? A man who turned young women into his own personal slaves, who collected nearly $1 million in insurance money, and married his dead wife's teenage sister, David Brown was a sociopath who would stop at nothing...a deadly charmer who almost got away with everything.This is a Bizarre story and unbelievably a True one. Anne Rule wrote a book based on the case called "If You Really Loved Me". This is definately a must see!The movie stars, Clancy Brown (Shawshank Redeption, Highlander), Moira Kelly, Sheryl Lee, Cynthia Nixon (Sex and the City), John Aston (Beverly Hills Cop)
summary: This is the Craziest based on reality murder crime I have ever saw!
